title: American Airlines and US Airways - key figures 2015
summary: This is a bar chart representing Key area in the x axis and Unnamed: 1 in the y axis.
The Unnamed: 1 is highest at Key area Available seat kilometres (in millions) and lowest at Key area Number of countries served.
There is a difference of 427478.0 between the maximum Key area Available seat kilometres (in millions) and minimum Key area Number of countries served.
min_summary: This bar chart has 7 columns on the x axis representing Key area, and Unnamed: 1 in each Key area on the y axis.
The maximum Unnamed: 1 427533.0 is found at Key area Available seat kilometres (in millions) and the minimum is found at Number of countries served where Key area is 55.0.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Key area in the x axis and Unnamed: 1 in the y axis.
The Unnamed: 1 is highest at Key area Available seat kilometres (in millions) and lowest at Key area Number of countries served.

max_summary: This bar chart has 7 columns on the x axis representing Key area, and Unnamed: 1 in each Key area on the y axis.
The Unnamed: 1 is appeared to be the highest at Key area Available seat kilometres (in millions) and lowest at Key area Number of countries served.
The second highest Unnamed: 1 is appeared to be the Key area Revenue passenger kilometers (in millions).
The highest Key area Available seat kilometres (in millions) has 427478.0 more Unnamed: 1 than the lowest Key area Number of countries served.

The Key area Available seat kilometres (in millions) has the highest Unnamed: 1, followed by Revenue passenger kilometers (in millions), and Number of daily departures. Down to the Key area Number of countries served which is the lowest.
The Key area Number of countries served has 3.8 times less Unnamed: 1 than average.
